p: In relation to ROC, the factors that were most related to high-risk areas were thermal amplitude and elevation. This is in accordance with the distribution of the Atlantic Forest biome, which covers a mountainous region that shelters the wild vectors, Aedes scapularis and Psorophora sp. mosquitoes. To the best of our knowledge, no reports have explained the emergence and sudden disappearance of ROC cases in the 1970s, but it is believed that this virus is remained in a cycle where birds, including some migratory species, are the reservoirs [ 12]. Furthermore, in 2004, antibodies were detected among birds in southern Brazil, and the ROC virus may be circulating in different Brazilian regions, which could represent a permanent threat of disease outbreaks [ 7, 12].
